pullRequest.title: Add EReference as bridge to external ecore models
pullRequest.bodyText:
Sorry, yet a nother huge pull reguest... :P
This one is a featue, though; it doesn't change any existing stuff.
(You can find a list of manually edited files on the bottem of this description)
The idea behind this feature is to integrate (for some reason) external ecore models.

Virtual Satellite now has a new property type for referencing external models. The PropertyDefinition references a EClass, the PropertyInstance an EObject or its generated derived from.
The concept language now has means to import external Ecore Metamodels and to create EReferences:

Its generator also creates Beans and references the generated classes from the external Ecore model.
Virtual Satellite Models (instance models) with concepts containing EReferences enable to laod external models into the ResourceSet and then referencing objects which are valid for the (in the concept) specified EClass. The generic UI engine creates a basic UI for that:

As this pull request involves quite a high number of files I recomand checking it out in our IDE and compare the branches there.
Following you will fine a list of changes you might want to look at:
de.dlr.sc.virsat.model

dvlm.ecore:         Added import class for concepts and the new classes for the EReferenceProperty and its intance
EReferencePropertyHelper:        Helps resolving the EClass type of EReferences
EReferencePropertyInstanceImplCustom:     (+ custom factory) add type check implementation
PropertyInstanceValueSwitch     added EReference case statement to all the PI-switches
DVLMReferenceCheck     adds check for EReferenceProperty

de.dlr.sc.virsat.model.edit

icons for new references
TypeSafeEReferenceArrayInstanceList    list implementation for EReference arrays in beans
BeanPropertyEReference       a bean wrapper for EReference values
DVLMERefererencePropertyInstanceItemProvider      custom label for EReferences
ActiveConceptConfigurationElement   don't try to active EReference types

de.dlr.sc.virsat.model.concept

ConceptLanguage.xtext      Added grammar rules for import and new reference type
GenerateCategoryBeans     Add bean implementations for EReferenceProperties
GenerateDMFCategories     Add EReference to DMF - it simply passes on the EObject values
ExternalGenModelHelper      Helps finding GenModels for the imported EPackages

de.dlr.sc.virsat.project

VirSatResourceSetUtil      Do not remove dangeling reference from active concepts (from the repository) if their EReferencePropertyDefinitions (-> Concept should still be useable even if external EPackage is not resolveable)
DmfResourceLoader      Implement Category -> DMF:DObject for EReferences
DmfResourceSaveCommand       DMF:Dobject -> Category for EReferences

de.dlr.sc.virsat.project.ui

EClassFilteredListContentProvider    List content provider that filters elements by their EClass
ResourceFilteredWrappedTreeContentProvider     Tree content provider that filters elements by their resource's file ending
VirSatFilteredListContentProvider   Show contained elements if input is resource

de.dlr.sc.virsat.uiengine.ui

EReferencePropertyCellEditingSupport     Cell editing support for EReferences
ReferenceSelectionDialog      new method to create a selection dialog for EReferences
AUiSnippetGenericPropertyInstances     Add editing functionality for EReferences in snippets. (Button to load resource and to set the new reference type)

Tests:

The added classes from above usually also have a new test class
New EMF project de.dlr.sc.virsat.model.external.tests(+edit) contains a test EMF model that is used in several test cases and is used in the tests-concept

All other edited files are either genererated or changed to integrate one of the above listed files (e.g. a new method in a factory)

nodes.bodyText:
I am a bit conflicted about the use of AExternalModelTest by inheriting from it. The GenerateCategoryBeansTest is not really an ExternalModelTest, but it does have some test cases involving external models. This might become an issue in the future since Java doesnt allow multi inheritance. So if we make, say, a class ABeansTest to unify test setup for all beans related test classes, this would become complicated.
So my question: Would it be possible to turn AExternalModelTest into a utility class that gets called in the test cases instead of inheriting from it?
Maybe its just github, but the intendation looks off here.
I think we also have the usual coding style that between an if/for and the bracket comes a whitespace in xtend files.

+		var String typeClass = null
+		var genPackage = resolveGenPackage(property)
+		
+		//If package could be found get class name
+		if(genPackage !== null) {

nodes.bodyText: The test case here tests various functionalities at once. This also makes it pretty long. Would it be possible to split it into multiple test cases?

Maybe this is a bit out of scope of the PR, but I dont like that we have the INDEX_NOT_EXISTENT declared at so many places (All list implementations, and their related test cases). I was thinking: Would it make sense to move the constant into the IBeanList interface and use it from there?
Superfluous whiteline.
Author tag.
Superflous white line
Why do we need to check equality via uuid instead of pi.equals(ca)
Why compare the uuids? Shouldnt the eReferencePropertyInstance be equal to the result of the array access?

Actually, I am a bit confused with this.
How can the uuid of some property instance be the same as the uuid of a category assignment?
Arent they (more or less) unrelated types?
BeanPropertyEReference<ETYPE> bean = new BeanPropertyEReference<ETYPE>();
BeanPropertyEReference<ETYPE> bean = new BeanPropertyEReference<ETYPE>();
Superflous whitepace.
Maybe add a class description.
Author tag.

nodes.bodyText: I dont think we need to version increase the version everytime we change the test concept, since it is not meant for productive use. The 1.1 version is there just to fully test the concept level migration, I believe.
Maybe we can put this comment at the beginning of the if and not at the end?
The description seems outdated.
Just wondering: Do we need the null check here or can the Set.Command.create deal with this case by itself?

commit.message: Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/development' into feature/task_408-EReference_in_concept

nodes.bodyText: I think i would go for a utility class as well instead of inheritance. Or maybe it is something that can be placed to AConceptTestCase. But there we have to be super careful that we are not creating havoc on the plugin dependencies etc.
Yes, but checkstyle probably does not evaluate xtend. 😞

nodes.bodyText: yes, i agree, should be moved.

This has been implemented in the lists to avoid issues in case objects get reloaded in between from the DLVM model.  Than you have different instances with the same UUID.
The question is, if the assumption back in the days was correct that there can be cases where we have this constellation of semantitcally same objects but as different instances. And we should think about the implications.
For me this is a more general question. And i guess this is taken from the other list implementations. Therefore i would accept it here and take the discussion to some other place.
@SaMuellerDLR Its yours 🤣 :

Add some style fixes - (Task #408)
